intro: Euryloma irbyana, commonly known as the Irby's euryloma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
